column4: U.S. insurer Fidelity National to buy FGL Holdings in $2.7 billion deal
column5: (Reuters) - Fidelity National Financial Inc FNF.N said here on Friday it would acquire U.S. annuities and life insurance firm FGL Holdings Inc FG.N in a deal valued at $2.7 billion, as it seeks to expand beyond its core business of insuring property buyers and sellers against ownership claims.
column6: Shares of FGL were up 1.2% in premarket trading. On Thursday, the stock closed up 19.4% after Reuters reported that the companies were nearing a deal.
column7: Under the terms of the cash-and-stock deal, the holders of FGL’s shares may elect to receive either $12.50 per share in cash or 0.2558 of a share of the FNF stock for each share of FGL they own, representing a premium of about 3% to FGL’s Thursday close.
column8: The deal, expected to close in the third quarter of 2020, is anticipated to increase Fidelity’s earnings per share by 10% in 2020 and by 20% in 2021.
column9: Des Moines, Iowa-based FGL, in which Fidelity currently has a 7.9% stake, generated $1.55 billion in revenue in the first nine months of 2019, up 68% year on year.
column10: FGL was acquired in 2017 in a $1.84 billion deal by an investor group led by a so-called special purpose acquisition company founded by veteran dealmaker Chinh Chu, as well as funds affiliated with private equity firm Blackstone Group Inc BX.N and Fidelity National Financial.
column11: “(FGL’s) management team and unique, deep relationship with Blackstone provides meaningful differentiation from competitors,” Fidelity said. Blackstone will continue to invest in FGL’s assets on the combined company’s behalf.
column12: Blackstone is expected to keep a stake in the combined company, Reuters reported on Thursday, citing sources.
column13: Based in Jacksonville, Florida, Fidelity provides title insurance and transaction services to the real estate and mortgage industries. Title insurance protects buyers and sellers against problems with a property’s title that might cause a transaction to be canceled.
column14: The company reported revenue of $6.1 billion for the first nine months of 2019, up 3.5% from a year earlier.
column15: Credit Suisse served as financial adviser to FGL and BofA Securities and Trasimene Capital advised Fidelity.

column4: Fidelity National to acquire FGL Holdings in $2.7 bln deal
column5: Feb 7 (Reuters) - Fidelity National Financial Inc said here on Friday it would acquire U.S. annuities and life insurance firm FGL Holdings Inc in a deal worth $2.7 billion.
column6: The deal is expected to add to Fidelity’s earnings per share by 10% in 2020 and by 20% in 2021. (Reporting by Bharath Manjesh in Bengaluru; Editing by Maju Samuel)

column4: Exclusive: Fidelity National nears deal to acquire FGL Holdings - sources
column5: (Reuters) - Fidelity National Financial Inc FNF.N is nearing a deal to acquire U.S. annuities and life insurance firm FGL Holdings Inc FG.N, as it seeks to expand beyond its core title insurance business, three people familiar with the matter said on Thursday.
column6: If the negotiations are concluded successfully, a deal for FGL, which has a market value of $2.7 billion, could be announced in the next few days, the sources said, cautioning that an agreement is not certain. The exact price being negotiated could not be learned.
column7: The sources asked not to be identified because the matter is confidential. FGL and Fidelity National Financial did not immediately respond to requests for comment.
column8: FGL shares ended trading up 19.4% at $12.15 following the news on Thursday. Fidelity National shares closed nearly flat at $49.04, giving the company a market capitalization of around $13.6 billion.
column9: Based in Des Moines, Iowa, FGL is a provider of annuity and life insurance products. It generated $1.55 billion in revenue in the first nine months of 2019, up 68% year on year.
column10: FGL was acquired in 2017 in a $1.84 billion deal by an investor group led by a so-called special purpose acquisition company founded by veteran dealmaker Chinh Chu, as well as funds affiliated with private equity firm Blackstone Group Inc BX.N and Fidelity National Financial.
column11: Fidelity National Financial had a 7.6% stake in FGL as of the end of September. Blackstone is expected to keep a stake in the combined company, two of the sources said. Blackstone will continue to invest FGL’s assets on the combined company’s behalf, one of the sources added.
column12: Based in Jacksonville, Florida, Fidelity National Financial provides title insurance and transaction services to the real estate and mortgage industries. It reported revenue of $6.1 billion in the first nine months of 2019, up 3.5% on the prior year period.

column4: EXCLUSIVE-Fidelity National nears deal to acquire FGL Holdings -sources
column5: Feb 6 (Reuters) - Fidelity National Financial Inc is nearing a deal to acquire U.S. annuities and life insurer FGL Holdings Inc, as it seeks to expand beyond its core title insurance business, people familiar with the matter said on Thursday.
column6: If the negotiations are concluded successfully, a deal for FGL, which has a market value of $2.3 billion, could be announced in the next few days, the sources said, cautioning that an agreement is not certain. The exact price being negotiated could not be learned.
column7: The sources asked not to be identified because the matter is confidential. FGL and Fidelity National Financial did not immediately respond to requests for comment. (Reporting by Joshua Franklin and David French in New York Editing by Matthew Lewis)

column4: U.S. sues to block merger of title insurance providers
column5: WASHINGTON (Reuters) - The U.S. Federal Trade Commission said on Friday that it had filed an administrative complaint aimed at preventing title insurance provider Fidelity National Financial, Inc. FNF.N from buying rival Stewart Information Services Corp STC.N.
column6: The FTC valued the deal at $1.2 billion.
column7: The two firms are among four that insure buyers and sellers against problems with a property’s title that might cause a transaction to be canceled, the FTC said.
column8: “Competitive title insurance and title information markets are essential to providing Americans affordable and high-quality title insurance products,” said Bureau of Competition Director Bruce Hoffman in a statement. “Our action seeks to preserve important and beneficial competition that plays out every day in every real estate transaction across the United States.”
column9: Stewart said in a statement that it was reviewing the lawsuit. “We are disappointed with this outcome and disagree with the FTC’s decision,” the company said in a statement. “We will communicate our next steps to our stakeholders in the near future as soon as this review is complete.”

column4: Fidelity sued over management of employees' 401(k) plan
column5: Employees of Boston-based Fidelity have sued the financial services giant alleging that it loaded their $15 billion retirement plan with the company’s own mutual funds, saddling it with excessive fees and poor returns.
column6: Filed on Wednesday in Boston federal court, the proposed class action said Fidelity’s alleged mismanagement cost participants in the 401(k) plan more than $100 million a year in returns, compared to returns of comparable plans.
column7: To read the full story on WestlawNext Practitioner Insights, click here: bit.ly/2PuBlST
